captions.text:
- I dated a girl from Montreal
for a year and a half.
- All right! I've been there twice.

- [Voiceover] What is
the capital of Canada?

- I only know, like,
three cities in Canada,
so I'm just going to say them.
- The capital, the capital of Canada?

- Let's go with Toronto,
where my Blue Jays at!
or there's something with Victoria in it.

- [Voiceover] Who is
the president of Canada?

- I don't think I've ever heard
of the president of Canada.
They got a prime minister, right?
- They got all that French influence.
Once you get Europe in your system,

all you're going to do
is have prime ministers.

- I was told that there wasn't
going to be math in this.
- I feel like nobody lives there.

I feel like I've visited
and seen thirty people.
- They're a tenth the size of America?

But just 'cause it's pretty
big, doesn't mean that

Drake doesn't even live
there, so that says a lot.

That's the one that I
should have remembered

Yeah, I knew it was a
'b' and it was mammal.
No, it's a white maple leaf on red,
or is it a red maple leaf on white?
Oh, I think I'm thinking of Japan.

Although I'm very proud that
Wisconsin doesn't touch Canada.
People think Wisconsin does touch Canada,

title: Americans Answer Basic Questions About Canada

comments.author: Tessa Parker

comments.text:
Guys...I don't want to sound like a cry baby or anything but scrolling 
through the comments of this video seriously hurt.
Why do countries always have to fight like this over stupid things...
You think America is stupid? Sure, think whatever you want. But you don't 
need to go ruin someone's day by needlessly commenting rude comments about 
each other's countries.
Canadians, I respect you but please don't be whiny and actually watch the 
video before you start saying that Americans are stupid because they 
thought Canada had a president. If you see later in the video they say that 
it was a trick question and commented that Canada had a prime minister.
Americans, stop trying to make a point by saying that "Some of the smartest 
people in the world are Americans," because honestly I still kinda think 
that is a minority and just because some of you are smart, it doesn't mean 
all of you are.
As an American I respect Canada and all other countries as well, but 
America deserves some respect, too.
All you 'Murican folk should learn some respect as well.
And all you other people around the world, please don't make it a messier 
fight. Two countries is enough.
I think some of you can learn from a 13-year-old Korean-American, eh?﻿

comments.author: Olivia Vincent

comments.text:
I'm American and I didn't know the answers to any of these questions. I do 
know what the flag of Canada looks like. I think Canada is awesome, but it 
was never really talked about in school. I remember having only two history 
classes NOT about the U.S. alone. I had Geography and World History, and we 
mostly learned about Europe. I don't even know the population of the United 
States, that number is always changing. I wouldn't know the answer to these 
questions about any other countries (except I know the capitals of Great 
Britain, Mexico and possibly some other Hispanic countries, because of 
Spanish class). There is just a lack of an education about other countries 
in school, unless it is a foreign language class or some other class. 
Furthermore, I have a horrible memory, so anything I don't use, I lose. I 
am forgetting my high school education every day I don't use it.﻿
